reviews.text:
never had a problem
well directed boards to each platform
get trains to most places in the UK

Appalling staff attitude.

Arrived at the south-bound platform entrance with my disabled sister to pick up my step-daughter and her baby.

Was told by a GWR employee that we could not possibly pick her up from this platform as the entrance was closed due to ongoing work and there were health and safety issues. This was clearly not the case as passengers were entering and leaving from this entrance and taxis were picking people up!
 
We would need to drive around to the north-bound entrance and my step-daugher would have to make her way over there. 

Was then told there was an exception for passengers travelling to Butlins in Minehead (not so much of a H&S issue, then?) who were allowed to exit the south-bound entrance. But, no exception could be made for a young woman travelling with her baby, pushchair and a lot of luggage.

Similar staff unhelpfulness on the return journey. On being asked the best carriage to get into with a pushchair I was met with an abrupt 'There isn't one!' (different member of station staff).

Time for some staff (re-)training.
I have to use assistance services there, can't fault them, makes my journey possible. Lovely friendly staff.
Terrible. Told to get train on incorrect platform. Staff not interested  need training on customer service..
